Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bianca M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Ideal for visiting the Vatican and within walking distance of most places of interest. 5min walk to metro station. Our room faced the main road, which is rather busy and can get a bit noisy at night. However, after all the walking during the day we slept like a log anyway, so the noise didnt bother us too much. Very friendly staff. Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous inn, right in the thick of things, and steps from the Vatican!”
Reviews.Author: fightingwithavim
Reviews.Content: I was arriving in Rome for a study abroad program and needed a place to stay for the night prior to my accommodations becoming available. I researched the options on Tripadvisor and wanted something close to the Vatican, as St. Peter's Square was a priority of mine to see first. 207 Inn was extremely comfortable and offered a great base of operations for that first day in the city. Great view of the busy street below, too! Very helpful staff and a tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Ankaja
Reviews.Content: A great base for exploring Vatican and Rome! Near Ottaviano station (Line A). The hotel is located on the 2nd floor of an typical roman building. The elevator is also old and at the same time very romantic. Rooms needs to be renovated (dirty walls) and TV set to be repaired. Breakfast was served to the room: juice, croissant and tea or coffee, so perfectly acceptable for a decent start for the day.

Reviews.Title: “B&B not far from the Vatican!!”
Reviews.Author: albyIMF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 207 Comfort Inn B&B in the second week of October 2011 for work. The B&B is located in Viale Giulio Cesare and it’s not far from the Vatican (about 10 minutes by foot)!! The B&B is also 50 metres near the “Ottaviano” underground station … so you can take the Underground to go to downtown!! The B&B has a front desk open 24 hours so if you arrive late in the evening it’s better to call them!! The B&B is at the first floor of an normal building but inside it’s quite modern!! The room is normal (not large and not small) and the bathroom is useful but not too big!! The room is located in Viale Giulio Cesare which is a very busy street so it’s better to sleep with the window closed!! The breakfast is served by the waitress in the room at the time you have defined with the front desk staff but it’s very poor breakfast!! It’s true that a lot of B&B have a poor breakfast but they could improve the service without a big effort!! So I suggest the 207 Comfort Inn B&B if you don’t want a luxurious room and service!! The quality / price ratio is good!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, very helpful reception!”
Reviews.Author: elisabethcp
Reviews.Content: This place was great. Lovely old building. Rooms decent, and beds not as small as we imagined. Street also not very noisy as we thought it might be. Breakfast was basic - croissants, juice and coffee, but frige in the room for fruit and yoghurt if you want to buy your own snacks. Situated right around the corner from the Vatican - great for a run in the morning. Also, we could run back to our room for the loo whilst waiting in the 2 hour Vatican museum queue! Lots of cheap bakeries and pizza joints downstairs. Also a great Jazz Club - oldest in Rome - just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: GrainneJones
Reviews.Content: My better half and I stayed at Hotel 207 for a week at the end of September to the beginning of October. This was our second trip to Rome this year, having stayed in the Golden Tulip Bellambriana in February. Hotel 207 far exceeded our expectations after reading less than positive reviews on Trip Advisor. I am glad to say we found all of them to be unfounded. We were greeted by a very friendly lady (can't for the life of me remember her name) who knew exactly who we were, checked us in and gave us a map of places of interest and places to avoid. We were then given a breakfast menu, choice of hot drink, juice and croissant which was delivered to our room every morning by one of the two friendly members of staff. We opted for the small room with balcony as we were on a budget. We expected to find a small single bed, as was advertised, but found a good sized double. The room itself was quite small, but still had a bedside table, dresser and wardrobe...and to be honest if you need a big hotel room to sit about in, in Rome, your missing out on a wealth of beauty that's just on your doorstep. Which is literally what you get with 207. St. Peters Square and the Vatican are a 5 minute stroll away, and for everything else the ottoviano metro stop is about a minute away, easily spotted from the balcony. There didn't seem to be any staff about after about 8 o clock, but in my opinion this just added to the feeling of being at home in Rome. I had read reports of the noise from the street and metro being unbearable, however the markets are closed up and gone by 9pm, not sure what time they start at as I always slept through their arrival-noise, when the doors were closed, was not a problem. You could occasionally hear the metro but unless you're as fussy a sleeper as say, the princess and the pea, the noise will not bother you. I cannot praise or recommend this place enough, we've been home for about a fortnight and I'm homesick for it...cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a wonderful location with very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: knoxy777
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girlfriend at the end of september 2010 and decided to opt for a room with a balcony even though we were told the room would be small with a tiny bed. We were surprised when we saw more or less a normal size bed. As we were spending most of our day sight seeing we didnt mind having a smaller room as the balcony more than made up for this. The hotel is very very clean, probably the cleanest place I have stayed, and the staff are extemely helpful and friendly-we didnt have any problems with language either as their English was good! We were seved breakfast in bed every day and had a choice of times for it to be delivered. There were plenty of inexpensive restaurants on our doorstep as well, along with a very cheap market just in front of the hotel. It was still quite warm when we stayed at around 27 degrees every day, but the room had air conditioning. Ottaviano Metro stop and the vatican are literally a stones throw away, so an excellent location for sightseeing. All in all I had a great time here and would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Not Recommend !!!! Must Avoid...”
Reviews.Author: skyrocket747
Reviews.Content: YOU SHOULD AVOID THIS HOTEL...I'M WARNING YOU FROM MY EXPERIENCE I made a booking to this hotel for more than a month and found out upon arrival to the hotel that the room just gone due to a problem with booking!!!!! It was an absolutely unacceptable reason and poor management since it supposed to be informed few days ago so that I could reorganize the hotel booking. I don't need to stay to that hotel, but finally I knew from the hotel reception after carring more than 40 kgs heavy weight bags via a long journey. Luckily, I arrived around 4-5 pm so I could rearrange the accommodation. WHAT IF YOU ARRIVE LATE AT NIGHT????????? it will be absolutely nightmare for you... So I'm warning you.....avoid this hotel.. It's so risky to find out yourself has no room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations”
Reviews.Author: julesrollo
Reviews.Content: Expectations is what it is all about. Hubby & I stayed at 207 for 3 nights before a Meditteranean Cruise with 2 other couples. Granted, our room was very tiny in comparison to what we are used to but we found it quaint, with a wonderful balcony where we could have a drink and watch the Romans at work and play. It was all clean and the great thing was that it was close to the Vatican and within walking distance of what we wanted to see. We also got the bus to go to the colloseum and other places. We didnt notice the noise at all and anyway, who wouldnt want to be serenaded by the local market stall owner who saw us sitting on the balcony having a vino! There were larger rooms available but without a balcony. It was a small (pardon the pun) price to pay to be able to use this at night and in the early morning which is the only time we were really in the room (who wants to watch TV when you are in Rome!). For breakfast we just did what the locals did and had a coffee and a pastry standing up at the little shop just a few doors away from the hotel (the owner was very accomodating with our lack of Italian but we did try!). In regard to the front desk there was a small problem with the language barrier but they did try thier best and were very polite if a little reserved. I found nearly all of the places in Italy that we visited wonderful and the people very willing to help you if you tried to speak a litte of their language. As my husband is fond of saying "Its all part of the experience". I would definitely recommend this hotel but only if your expectations are realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but be prepared to fend for yourself......”
Reviews.Author: markD78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 2 nights in June - but only ended-up staying one. We left early - our choice. I will start this off by saying we are level headed people, who travel a lot. We know what level of service to expect when staying at a hotel. This review is being written in a very level-headed mindset. My purpose is to warn other travellers. When you need something at this hotel - be prepared to potentially fend for yourselves - seriously. Our experience was we only saw a staff member when we were checking in (we booked 2 nights, and were around at 'normal' hours). No other staff was to be found anywhere - and NO WAY to get a hold of them. This ended-up being a major inconvenience for us. Our first issue - day 1 in the room - we ran out of toilet paper and actually had to go out to a store and buy our own. No staff to be found anywhere. This set the tone for what was to come next........ We were told that the hotel could help us book transportation to the Airport, and were counting on them for their help. Our flight was leaving very early (before the metro even started), and we needed their help to arrange for a taxi to arrive at 4am for us. Seeing as we did not see anyone to help - we left the night before, as there were still taxis on the street, and we knew there was no risk of making our flight. This was our choice - but should NOT have been necessary. If you're running a business - have someone there to help your clients (or at least a number we could call to request help). Making a long story short - we spent the night at the Airport, and still paid for our room. When I contacted Priceline.com to help resolve this issue they assured me that 207 Inn would contact me directly. They never did. All I wanted was for this to be fair - maybe half of my money back for the night before seeing as we technically 'had the room'. 207 Inn - I assure you - the next time we return to Rome we will NOT be staying again. You have a nice hotel, but that is being wasted by your lack of customer service. To anyone reading this review - unless you know Rome really well (I've been there 5 times as well) - re-consider staying at 207 Inn.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tonyleeSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a group of 6, the rooms are very clean, avaerage to large size, ask for the rooms with balconies and you do loose some indoor space however. The staff are great and very friendly and helpfull, perfect location for getting all around rome. would recommend this hotel and its staff. this is not a large multi national just a good friendly home from home style. enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrixieAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 207 Comfort Inn the last leg of our European visit- I booked it off a website -Orbitz or Expedia- For all of our travels I always come to TripAdvisor to read the reviews and I have never been disappointed! The hotel was great- Great location, so very close to the Vatican (walking distance) and it was very very clean- The staff was friendly and helpful- There were restaurants right below the hotel and on the corner- The shopping was delightful - street vendors set up right outside the hotel front door and had awesome bargains- I loved it because it had a neighborhood feel and did not feel touristy- The rooms had a safe and working tv and heater- We would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hell on Earth?”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4711
Reviews.Content: We booked the 207 Comfort Inn because of the overwhelmingly positive feedback on tripadvisor. We did not care much about the comparably high price (150 Euro/night) since we thought to have found a gem in Rome which is worth the money… no chance. We left the “hotel” after 5 days although we had to pay for the full ten days of our planned stay - and that’s why we left: We really need a quiet room for the night after a buzzling day out in Rome and the Comfort Inn claimed to have “soundproof” windows. Rubbish! They have simple thermo-isolated windows with almost no sound-blocking function and all rooms go to the main street so you have no alternative. The Via J. Cesare is a very frequented street with a permanent street market so you might expect to be “soundproofed” until midnight at least. Do not be disappointed anyway: If it’s not the street noise that keeps you awake, it’s the underground that goes right under the building. The metro ends at midnight and starts again at 5 am. But do not expect to have 5 hours of continuous sleep. There are eight or so waste containers just in front of the “hotel” and garbage collection is every night at 3 am for half an hour. Believe it or not they really come every night (at least during the five nights we spent). This is for the noise but it is not the end of our complaints list. One evening we had no warm water because the boiler was down. They do not serve their own breakfast but you get a voucher for a cup of coffee and one piece of pastry at a neighbouring bar – if you get it. Only at one out of five mornings there was a person at the reception desk. No voucher no breakfast. Good strategy to save money. At least the bar is very good and not too expensive. There were a lot of smaller annoyances such as: new towels only every second day (do not expect that they are dry the next day), no depositing opportunity in the bathroom, tiny TV with only one English channel (BBC world which drops out during rain), no telephone, small beds, very restricted English skills of the staff (although they try to be helpfull) etc.. Altogether we spend a holiday we will never forget. If this is what you are looking for. Go ahead!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonstevo
Reviews.Content: Rooms were quite small but VERY clean. Receptionist polite and helpful. Centrally situated and very easy access to the whole city. A little expensive in comparison to its 4* competitors. Contrary to comments on here the rooms do have safes inside the wardrobe. Not sure about breakfast but was unable to get coffee at anytime. Also no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. Out of the hotel and 1st right is a restaurant called la caravella,, food was excellent and service good ,value for money ok. Another restaurant in the next street was L Isola Della Pizza. 80 euros for 2 but very very busy and good quality food. Not many tourists in there but was full, (a good sign)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: OxfordRach
Reviews.Content: I would just like to warn people before they book this establishment BUT I NEVER DID STAY THERE. I booked my stay months in advance with a credit card. No one contacted me to let me know that it had expired until 2 months later. I was given 48 hours to contact them. I did so in an hour; however, they decided to virtually double the overall stay. I think this is disgusting and I would just like to recommend that you do not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rsmiller
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel in a superb location. Stayed at the 207 Comfort Inn for a week and was greeted by very friendly staff who couldn't do enough for us. The entrance is grand and the rooms are very stylish and clean. We had a balcony as well which made it even better. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the vatican musium entrance and the Ottaviano metro stop is on the door step. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Same as last November”
Reviews.Author: mcbabci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again for 2 days. This time there were 8 of us. I knew that it would be easy for us to get around especially for several in our group who were having problems with their feet. The Vatican is around the corner. The metro is one block away. And buses to anywhere in the city can be boarded only a few blocks away from this hotel. This time we bought the Roma Pass when we arrived at Termini. Check out this pass. It's better than looking for a tobacco shop to buy a metro or bus tickets. Again the staff was very helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are big. The air-conditioning works. And it's easy to find good restaurants in the area. This is definitely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the 207 Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: vdurrer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It is very comfortable and the staff is friendly. When we arrived, we had followed directions from other tripadvisor reviews, which was really helpful. The hotel is right next to the metro and very close to the Vatican. The staff oriented us when we arrived and although no breakfast is included you can purchase coffee and pastries in the hotel in the morning. The coffee is very good. The room has AC. It is very clean and the bed comfortable. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin B
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a 4 day stay in this hotel in Rome, And we found It just as described by most previous members. The rooms are small but immaculate and modern, and it is obviously not long since it was decorated. It is 50 yards to the metro which we used twice to get back to the hotel. {1 euro gets you a ticket valid for 75 minutes, and I think you can travel as far as you lke within that time, and about 15 minutes walk to st peters square, where you can catch the audience most wednesdays at 11 am. Plenty of restaurants around for dinner within a reasonable walking distance . We used A-T-S via easyjet to book the transfers, and they found the hotel easy, but it is true that there are no signs to tell you what it is, just the number 207 above the door, which is of course the number of the street. Entry is gained by pressing the bell and speaking to reception who open the door by pressing a button, but that adds to the security of the place. No safes in the rooms, as claimed by the website, but they take your stuff off you and put it into theirs. not very convenient but it is there.Also there is very little chance of a courtesy room if you have a late departure, as they only have 10 rooms, and are usually fully booked. we did not leave till 6 pm, so had nowhere to wash or shower after a day in the centre. On the whole this is an excellent small hotel in a very good location, And we would definitely go back and consider it a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TeamBob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Very clean, nicely decorated rooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Very good location, only 15 minute walk from the Vatican. Although breakfast was not included, there was a great cafe a few doors down which provided a nice breakfast. Good price too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - basic but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: helenlouise24
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Inn for 4 nights and found the service to be very good. The hotel was exactly how it was described when we booked it - basic, but very clean. The people at reception were always very helpful and spoke very good english. The only fault we found was that the area was not overly pleasant however, the hotel was only a 2 minute walk from the metro station so this was not a problem for us. Overall we had a good stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a basic but cheap and clean place to stay while exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Godders1968
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the 207. Very easy to book with Venere.Com. Hotel is easy to find by the Ottavanio metro. Staff very helpful and all spoke good English. Room small but stylish, new and clean. Very handy for St Peters and Vatican as well as the tour bus stops. No 81 bus to Colosseum. Plenty bars and cafe nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stanley_Cooper
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for Five days last week and it's pretty basic hotel, more like a travel lodge than anything else but at least the room was modern, good firm bed and great shower which woke me up everyday. I was also lucky to have a balcony so I could watch the traffic and the people go by which did wake me up in this morning I must add. Bad points for this place is that there isn't any safety deposit boxes which other web sites mention, apparently as the hotel is new it doesn't have this facility I was told. From what I could tell it doesn't have any breakfast facilities apart from making a cup of coffee although I found there was a cafe across the street which has everything you need for a good breakfast. Plus points is the location, you are a few minutes around the corner from the vatican and a great location for shopping with a market in front of the hotel. I would recommend staying at this hotel based on the location alone. Marc.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey but nice people”
Reviews.Author: nuts7hawk
Reviews.Content: I was impressed most with the security of this hotel and it is in a great location. Close to metro and not too far from the train station. Vatican was nearby. Simone was very helpful and not too bothered by my lack of Italian. He was kind enough to check on us as we almost slept our second day away with jet lag or we would've missed some of our precious time in Rome. A few observations. It was a bit noisy being on the street above temporary vendors and the bed was a little hard for my taste. I felt this property was a bit overpriced -- in fact the most we paid the whole time I was in Italy. Breakfast is not inlcuded, but there's a good pattisserie across the srteet and all the services you would need are nearby: post office, cheap place to make calls home and get on the Internet , and plenty of pizza of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday in Rome in Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to David ( RoomsAccomodation) We booked this Hotel, It's marvellouse, quite and not expensive, not so far from Vatican City and downtown ! Perfect location great value We booked by an internet Hotel Reservation system , RoomsAccomodation. They also booked for me pick up taxi service from the airport and some excursions in Rome (Angels and Demons Tour )

HotelInfo.Name: 207 Comfort Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Giulio Cesare 207, 00100 Rome, Italy
